trans-unit.source: Represents a layout control that aligns a bullet and another visual object.
BulletDecorator has two content properties: <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> property defines the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> to use as a bullet.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> property defines a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> that visually aligns with the bullet.

A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> always aligns with the first line of text when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> object is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> object is not a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock>, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> aligns to the center of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> object.
For more information about layout of a BulletDecorator, see [How to: Create a BulletDecorator](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d9532e9a-a2a5-47b9-aa37-c36f841b34ae).
The following illustration shows examples of BulletDecorator controls.
![3 BulletDecorators: CheckBox, RadioButton, TextBox](~/add/media/bulletdecorator.png "3 BulletDecorators: CheckBox, RadioButton, TextBox")
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> class.
Overrides the default content arrangement behavior for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.

The ArrangeOverride method determines the size and position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> is aligned vertically with the first line of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> content.
The available <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to use to lay out the content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.
The computed size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.
Gets or sets the background color for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.
The Background property defines the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brush> to use to fill the area within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator>.

For some parent layout elements, the area that is defined for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> may extend beyond its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> content.

For example, if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> is the single child of a cell in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid> control, the Background property applies to the whole cell.
This occurs because the content in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid> cell is stretched in all directions to fill the cell, by default.

However, if you set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.VerticalAlignment> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator>, the Background property only affects the actual content area of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator>.
Alternatively, you can enclose the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel> element.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |

The background color for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet*> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child*> of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Background*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the object to use as the bullet in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref>.

The Bullet property is a content property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> control and defines the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> to display as a bullet for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> object.
The bullet that is defined by setting the Bullet property to a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> is the first visual element in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> control.
The single <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> element is the second visual element.
## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ```
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> to use as the bullet.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the child element that is at the specified index.

The visual child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> are the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> properties.
The specified index for the child element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child element that is at the specified index.
index is less than 0.
-or- index is greater than or equal to .
Gets an enumerator for the logical child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.

The logical child elements for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> control include the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A>.
If you set both properties, they are enumerated in the following order: <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A>.
The number of visual child elements is the same as the number of logical child elements.
The enumerator that provides access to the logical child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Overrides the default measurement behavior for the objects of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.
The upper <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> limit of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref>.

The required <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control, based on the size of its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet*> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child*> objects.
Renders the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.
This method creates a <xref:System.Windows.Rect> structure that is sized for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> content.
This rectangular structure is displayed with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Background%2A> color and no border.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref>.
Gets the number of visual child elements for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref> control.
The VisualChildrenCount can be 0, 1, or 2.
If either the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> element is defined, the VisualChildrenCount is 1.
If both the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> element are defined, the VisualChildrenCount is 2.
The number of visual child elements is the same as the number of logical child elements.
The number of visual elements that are defined for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator"></xref>.
The default is 0.
